alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 2:00PM CST until further notice by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi, including the following county and parishes, in southeast Louisiana, East Baton Rouge, East Feliciana, Iberville, Pointe Coupee, St. Helena, West Baton Rouge and West Feliciana. In southern Mississippi, Amite. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in isolated locations in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Another round of light to moderate rain and thunderstorms continues to build into the region over the next few hours. Be aware that areas of ponding may continue over the region into mid to late afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Clinton, Slaughter, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Felps, Erwinville and Ramah. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena
